content.text:
# Timeline of Chinese texts

This is a timeline of important Chinese texts including their final primary author and character count when available.
11th century BC
{| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;"
|-
! style="width:6%" | Year || style="width:10%" | Date || Event
|-
| valign="top" | around 1050 BC || || Etiquette and Ceremonial (56,115 characters) by the Duke of Zhou
|-
| 11th-7th c. BC || || Classic of Poetry (39,224 characters)
|}
9th century BC
{| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;"
|-
! style="width:6%" | Year || style="width:10%" | Date || Event
|-
| rowspan="3" | around 850 BC || rowspan="3" | || I Ching (24,207 characters)
|-
|Lianshan
|-
|Guicang
|}

|-
| rowspan="2" |484 BC
| rowspan="2" |
|Book of Documents (25,000 characters) compiled by Confucius
|-
|Yi Zhou Shu, materials related to but not compiled into Book of Documents

|468 BC
